title: Merck deal for Seagen unlikely to be finalized ahead of earnings later this month, sources say; Deal talks still on track but upcoming data, arbitration slowed timeline, people familiar with the matter say
text:
The change is due partly to a need to wait for data expected soon from a study evaluating one of Seagen's SGEN treatments, the people said. There is also a desire to possibly see the outcome of a royalties-payments case Seagen is pursuing that is also expected soon, the people said. Both could have an impact on Seagen's valuation.

An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.

Merck deal for Seagen unlikely to be finalized ahead of earnings later this month, sources say
